product.composition: Top notes: blood orange, mandarin; middle notes: lily of the valley, base notes: patchouli.

story.inspiration: A mad waltz danced around Grasse rose and a veil of lily of the valley as light as a tulle petticoat. A radiant Miss Dior who throws herself headlong into a never-ending whirlwind of life and love.

comments: Reminds me of mix between blooming bouquet, Chanel eau tendre and a touch of the EDP!!! Love it, so feminine and soft, yet sweet.
Its opening is a burst of citrus and then I get a very lovely rose scent that seems to blend with the citrus. The patchouli is very nice and smooth in the base.

product.accords: balsamic, sweet, woody, white floral, fruity, warm spicy
product.composition: Top notes: coriander, spice; middle notes: tuberose; base notes: opoponax.

story.inspiration: Forbidden fruit from the house of Dior, Poison is the revolutionary fragrance that became a legend since it has been launched. An unrivalled alchemy; spicy, fruity, woody fragrance of enigmatic profoundness that mesmerizes the senses…forever.

comments: My favorite perfume EVER. If you don't like this fragrance, I don't want to know you. It's that good. I've literally hunted a woman down in a crowd to locate the woman who was sophisticated enough to wear this unique gem of a fragrance. I wanted to know her.

To me it’s a very mysterious, sexy, and mature scent. There is a character called The Warden from the children’s novel, Holes. She’s vicious, and is known to put rattlesnake venom in her nail polish. I imagine her wearing Dior Poison :)

product.accords: floral, fruity, white floral, sweet, aquatic
product.composition: Top notes: ylang-ylang; middle notes: damascena rose; base notes: grasse jasmine.

story.inspiration: The classic and ambitions of this fragrance reflects in the bottle shaped like Greek amphora. J’adore presents a new conception of Dior feminity, a scent so new and so in line with Dior style at the same time.

comments: This is a beautiful floral fragrance that lasts about 4 hours on my skin. There is very little sweetness to my nose. I picture a beautiful bride walking down the aisle, in a lush garden ceremony. For me, it's graceful and timeless.
An every day fragrance that is hard to 'dislike', which comes with the backdrop that it is not a special nor complicated at all. A hint of fruity sweetness, but still rather elegant and fresh.

product.accords: white floral, balsamic, powdery, floral, aromatic, citrus
product.composition: Top notes: citrus, neroli; middle notes: centifolia rose, jasmine grandiflorum from Grasse; base notes: sandalwood, patchouli, Madagascar vanilla.

story.inspiration: An explosive eau de parfum that is a fragrance of floral fireworks presented in a bottle finely crafted like a jewel.

comments: Typical MUSKY-JASMINEY-VANILLA-WITH-HINTS-OF-ROSES scent. Clean, opulent everyday scent that is blissful and largely relaxing.
Smoother, warmer, deeper, richer, less citrusy and definitely an “oriental” version of the original. Lovely and sophisticated dry down for sure, with a classy Dior's trait.
